start startupmanager 4th tab called Default and then tick automatically update default boot option
4th tab called Advanced even

well its a bit confusion it first says you need to just set a value to true in /etc/defaults/grub, and a bit further down it talks about adding some custom rules, not really clear if you need the latter
just make sure update-grub2 finishes properly every time you run it ;)

i was
I figured out that you just need to add GRUB_SAVEDEFAULT=true to /etc/default/grub to get the save default working
